title: Golden Spike National Historic Site: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park       Learn more about Golden Spike!!!  News Browse press releases.   Photos and more Experience the site through the lens! Check out our photo galleries and more.   History & Culture The workers that built the First Transcontinental Railroad and the politicians, businessmen, and others associated with this project left left a legacy that formed a nation. Discover the history of the project they completed and the impact this made on the world .   Nature Learn more about the unique landscape, flaura, and fauna that distinguish the locoation where this engineering marvel was finally completed. Golden Spike's ecosystem and scenery has had little change since the laborers came to this area almost 150 years ago.   Science & Research Learn more about the research that is being completed within the site.   Education Having made a major impact on Westward Expansion and many other aspects of the development of the nation, the history of this site holds a important educational story for students and teachers throughout the world.   Kids & Youth Learn how to become a junior ranger and find suggestions for family activities in the park.   Bookstore Western National Parks Association is the non-profit partner that manages the site's bookstore. A percentage of all purchases made go to support Golden Spike National Historic Site and the other locations wihtin WNPA's stewardship.
